text: Quran was first reveled on mount Hera
label: Islamic

text: The Quran mentions "water" (ماء) 33 times and "land" (برّ/يابس) 12 times—close to Earth’s 71% water and 29% land ratio (approximate match).
label: Islamic

text: Quran 57:25 states iron "was sent down," matching science that iron forms in supernovas (Surah Al-Hadid, "Iron").
label: Islamic

text: Quran 23:12-14 describes human development stages (nutfah, alaqah, mudghah) resembling modern embryology.
label: Islamic

text: Quran 51:47 says, "We are expanding it," aligning with Hubble’s discovery of cosmic expansion.
label: Islamic

text: Quran 55:19-20 mentions a barrier (barzakh) between fresh and saltwater, matching estuaries’ salinity gradients.
label: Islamic

text: Quran 86:1-3 describes a "knocking star" (Tariq), resembling pulsars’ rhythmic radio waves.
label: Islamic

text: Quran 21:30 states, "the heavens and earth were joined," akin to the singularity before the Big Bang.
label: Islamic

text: Quran 21:30 states, "the heavens and earth were joined," akin to the singularity before the Big Bang.
label: Islamic

text: Quran 78:7 calls mountains "pegs," reflecting their deep roots (isostasy) in geology.
label: Islamic

text: Quran 36:38 notes the sun "runs to a resting place," matching its orbit around the Milky Way.
label: Islamic

text: Quran 24:40 describes deep-sea darkness and waves, confirmed by submarine exploration.
label: Islamic

text: It is mentioned that "We made every living thing from water", which aligns with NASA's JWST telescope discovering water vapor in the atmosphere of exoplanet K2-18 b in 2023, suggesting potential for life.
label: Islamic

text: Surah Al-An’am (6:59) – The verse states "Not a leaf falls but He knows it", which correlates with modern research (2022) revealing that plants communicate through underground fungal networks, dubbed the "Wood Wide Web."
label: Islamic

text: Surah Al-Hajj (22:47) – Allah says "A day with Allah is like 1,000 years of your reckoning", matching Einstein’s theory of relativity proven by atomic clocks on GPS satellites (2020) showing time moves faster in space.
label: Islamic

text: Surah An-Nahl (16:69) – The Quran mentions "From the bee’s belly comes a drink of varying colors, healing for mankind", confirmed by 2023 studies showing Manuka honey’s effectiveness against antibiotic-resistant bacteria like MRSA.
label: Islamic

text: Surah Al-Anbiya (21:32) – The verse "We made the sky a protected ceiling" corresponds with NASA’s 2021 findings about Earth’s magnetosphere shielding life from deadly solar winds.
label: Islamic

text: Surah Al-Baqarah (2:30) – Allah declares "I will place a vicegerent on Earth", which parallels 2024 research on the human microbiome revealing gut bacteria significantly influence human health and decision-making.
label: Islamic

text: Surah Al-Mursalat (77:8-9) – The Quran describes "When the stars are extinguished... and the sky is torn apart", resembling 2022 Event Horizon Telescope images of black holes warping spacetime.
label: Islamic

text: Surah Fussilat (41:53) – "We will show them Our signs in the horizons and within themselves" aligns with 2023 quantum physics breakthroughs achieving quantum teleportation over 1,200 km.
label: Islamic

text: Surah Al-Qiyamah (75:38) – The verse "Then He shaped and proportioned" the embryo matches 2024 genetic research uncovering how DNA folding directs embryonic development.
label: Islamic

text: Surah Adh-Dhariyat (51:47) – Allah states "We are expanding the universe", directly confirmed by JWST’s 2023 data proving dark energy accelerates cosmic expansion.
label: Islamic

text: Discovery (2023): NASA’s JWST detected water vapor in the atmosphere of exoplanet K2-18 b, suggesting habitable conditions.
label: Non-Islamic

text: Studies revealed fungal networks (mycorrhiza) transmit signals between trees (dubbed the "Wood Wide Web").
label: Non-Islamic

text: Atomic clocks on GPS satellites confirm time moves faster in space (relativity).
label: Non-Islamic

text: Manuka honey found to combat antibiotic-resistant bacteria (e.g., MRSA).
label: Non-Islamic

text: NASA confirmed Earth’s magnetosphere deflects solar winds, preserving life.
label: Non-Islamic

text: Research shows gut bacteria influence human decisions (brain-gut axis).
label: Non-Islamic

text: EHT captured black holes "ripping" spacetime (e.g., Sagittarius A*).
label: Non-Islamic

text: Scientists achieved quantum teleportation over 1,200 km (China’s Micius satellite).
